timeline.bodyText: I'm missing a similar approach to test write new method in CloudEvent class
timeline.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: Im waiting for the result of a discussion with Enrique to add unit test, thats why this still a draft
replies.author: fjtirado

replies.bodyText: ok - let me know once it's done or request a new review from me.
replies.author: afalhambra

timeline.bodyText: Why are we only taking into account incomingNodes and not outgoing ones? if for instance an EndEventHandler node is processed, we are not considering this to be updated accordingly in the list of topics? - am I missing something here? can you please clarify?
timeline.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: this is for subscription, we are only interested on the signals which are input, not output
replies.author: fjtirado

replies.bodyText: when you say subscription, you mean for the kafka consumer? or? - I mean this method is also used by Kafka producer, so we will still need to know what topic we will send the record to when publishing from the producer? sorry about that, I don't mean it's wrong, it's just that I'm trying to fully understand.
replies.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: this method is only used for consuming, to calculate the topics the extension needs to be subbsribed, for this calculation only signal or mesagges associated with incoming nodes are really needed
replies.author: fjtirado

timeline.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: as far as I know, close internally invoke flush (in reality it waits for the acks till a timeout is reach) so it will be redudant to call flush here
replies.author: fjtirado

timeline.bodyText: also, shouldn't it be beneficial to call close with a timeout? maybe configurable through a system property - wdyt?
timeline.author: afalhambra

replies.bodyText: I would normally agree, but this is destroy, which is invoked only when server is closed, default timeout wil be fine, we do not want to give the user to specify a long one and interfere on the server cleanup procedure
replies.author: fjtirado

replies.bodyText:
then, maybe we should actually invoke the close(Duration timeout) instead passing a low value cause the default timeout for the close() method is pretty high (it's Long.MAX_VALUE):
https://github.com/apache/kafka/blob/2.6/clients/src/main/java/org/apache/kafka/clients/producer/KafkaProducer.java#L1158
replies.author: afalhambra

timeline.bodyText:
we need two properties here.
KAFKA_EXTENSION_PREFIX.signals.mapping=(NONE) -> (by default or AUTO)
KAFKA_EXTENSION_PREFIX.messages.mapping=AUTO -> (or NONE)
the idea would be that in the future we can say extends which signals we need to map
timeline.author: elguardian

timeline.bodyText:
right now we have the metadata in the signal node regarding this so the behaviour should be like this.
if the signal map property is AUTO... we should MAP unless the implementation exists says otherthing than kafka
if it is none we should not map unless the property says kafka.
metadata overrides the flags.
timeline.author: elguardian

replies.bodyText: not including metadata at the moment
replies.author: fjtirado
